alert.note: Alert for Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:02PM EDT until July 14 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN PRINCE GEORGES...NORTHWESTERN CHARLES...NORTHEASTERN STAFFORD...SOUTHEASTERN FAIRFAX AND SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTIES... At 701 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Clinton to 6 miles south of Fort Hunt to near Quantico, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Waldorf, Clinton, Fort Washington, Fort Hunt, La Plata, Fort Belvoir, Woodbridge, Quantico, Montclair, Camp Springs, Oxon Hill, Rosaryville, Friendly, Marlton, Triangle, Dumfries, Saint Charles, Cherry Hill, Mount Vernon and Accokeek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
